text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES), known as the Super Famicom in Japan, is a video game console developed by Nintendo and released on November, 1990. The console's looks were redesigned for the North American audience. The SNES features a 16-bit architecture to rival Sega's 16-bit Mega Drive/Genesis and to a lesser extent NEC's PC-Engine and SNK's Neo-Geo AES. The Satellaview, or BS-X, was released in 1995 exclusively in Japan to download special-edition games via a satellite network hosted by St.GIGA.
